text: On tap. Pours cola black. Nose is mostly chocolate with some cacao. Taste follows. Medium body. Smooth drinkable beer.

Nitro tap. Appears dark with a foaming, clingy light tan head. Nose is of powder cocoa. Palate follows with cacao nibs and a smooth, creamy, and light-medium body. Nothing flashy here, just mild all-season eligible dark beer.
Tap at cbc16, copenhagen. Dark brown color, tanned head. Aroma has coffee, some caramel notes and hint of chocolate. Nice roasty body has lots of coffee notes, some chocolate, smooth palate.
backlog. Cold brew aroma with some strong cocoa and vanilla notes. Creamy mouthfeel, rich for the style, very nice.

Taste: Smooth mocha coffee, Chocolate malts, cacao nibs, creamy mouthfeel to the finish. Big cacao bean and vanilla coffee aroma. Dark Brown and mostly clear with a tan refined head of good lace on glass. Medium body. easy to drink this slick coffee brown ale.
Nitro on tap strong cocoa and coffee senses pours black with tan head nice easy drinker

On nitro tap at JL Beers, Grand Forks. Dark brown, nearly black pour with a rich tan head. Aroma is plenty of cocoa, hints of coffee, a little nutty. Taste is soft chocolate and black coffee. Nice, but slightly disappointing as a special release from Surly.
Nitro pour, large creamy tan head, great lacing. Aroma is roasty cocoa, lactose, hints of coffee, vanilla. Flavor is medium sweet, very light bitter, rich and creamy. Medium body, silky mouthfeel.
A very good brown ale. Potent coffee character. Surprisingly acidic. Dark brown and delicious sweet.

What I liked most was the balance, but I expected this to be more explosive. The coffee and chocolate scents were there, but the body approached a milk stout, which seemed out of place. Sweet finish that had a pleasant duration.

Minnesota Trip Beer #29. Keg at Surly, 5/8/16. Dark brown, large foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of strong coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts. The taste is coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, oats. Medium bodied.

Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Yellow Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Surly Cacao Bender ].Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, coffee, cacao, vegetable coffee. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, coffee - cacao, dusty, vegetable coffee, roasted - dark roasted. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160513]

On tap at Darkness Day. Pours a dark brown with medium creamy tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong mocha, vanilla bean, roast. Medium body, nice sweetness, roast, vanilla, light bitter finish, very nice.
On tap at CBC 2016, yellow session. Pours brown with ruby haze. Off-white head. Roasted malts, coffee, cocoa, vanilla. Sweetish. Dry bitter finish. Medium bodied.
Draught. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average mderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
pour dark brown with a fine white head. aromas of coffee vanilla, light grass, taste light sweet light bitter. medium bodied. average carbonation.

Tap. Pours dark reddish brown with a medium light brown head. Aromas of fruity coffee, dates, malt, chocolate, light hoppy, cocoa powder. Taste has bread, caramel, toast, light hops, coffee, dark fruits.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are cocoa, roast malt, coffee, fruits, hops and has a nice sweet cocoa finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours reddish brown with a Brown head. Aroma of fruity Coffee, Cocoa, vanilla and sweet nuts. Taste has some roasted malts, plums, Cocoa, nuts and some hoppy notes.
Duft lidt karamel lidt ristet malt smag ristet kaffe vanilje lidt humle lidt gr√∏n kaffe karamel
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Clear medium brown body with a small offwhite head. Caramel, chocolate, mild coffee, cocoa, vanilla.

CBC 2016 Yellow session. Brown body with a big tanned head. Aroma of chocolate, mild coffee notes, wood and earthy hops. Taste of brown malt, mild sweet chocolate, roast, biscuit. Hints of fruitcake in finish. Short bitterness, with a lasting light chocolate aftertaste.

Deep dark brown pour with a single finger tan head. Aroma is very sweet, full of cocoa nibs & vanilla with a hint of coffee. Medium bodied. Flavor is complex with coffee, bitter dark chocolate and a little vanilla. Really tasty. Some lace present.

Aroma is coffee, roasted malts, some toffee and earth. Flavour is coffee, liquorice, some mild alcohol and a bit nutty notes.

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of malt, wood, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, light vegetables notes. Flavor is light sweet, malty, caramel, coffee, chocolate, cocoa. Medium body, soft to average carbonation, dry finish. 130516

Draft at Churchkey in D.C. Mahogany body with a silky, viscous tan head. Grandiose aroma of roasted, freshly ground coffee beans. Additional notes of chocolate, toffee. Like an iced coffee beer. Bold coffee scent and flavor throughout. Nicely done.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Yellow session, K√∏benhavn
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, coffee, caramel, cocoa and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long coffee, cocoa and chocolate. Taste is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

CBC. Dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, bread, vegetables, hop and cocoa. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, bread, medium sweet, hop, vegetables, coffee, medium sweet, cacao and a little bitter.

Dark brown and light cloudy with a small tan head. Aromas of cocoa, chocolate-coffee and some vanilla strikes but also shows notes of toast and nuts. Fine perlage, slick and medium-full bodied. Chocolate-coffee flavour, well balnced sweetness with a touch of bitterness. Medium lasting finish. Pleasant.

Draft. Medium beige head atop clear dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, cocoa, some nut, light caramel. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, some cocoa, vanilla. Light-medium body, light stickiness. Cocoa dominates, but not overly sweet.

Delicious chocolate and coffee aroma, thin palate and easy to drink. Satisfying for days when a heavier dark beer is too much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Yellow session. Dark brown to black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, cocoa, caramel. Sweet and biter taste like aroma. Light to medium thin to oily body with soft carbonation.
Tap at CBC 2016, yellow session. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, cacao, vanilla and some nuts. The flavours starts sweet but finish bitter with lingering coffe notes. Medium and oily.

At Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Yellow session.
amber, clear
aroma of cacao hobey, nice
taste bitter cacao, clean. thin texture.
Tap @ CBC¬í16. Yellow session. Cloudy brownish pour with a decent head. Tons of coffee, some vanilla, sweet caramel and light roast.

Draught at CBC 2016. High creamy lasting off-white head. Hazy dark brown body. Cocoa coffee vanilla aroma wih an odd note of cabbage. Nicy creamy cocoa dominated flavor with coffee and vanilla. Lillte hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish.

Tap at CBC ¬í16, Yellow session. Mahogany coloured body, low tan-coloured head, solid lacework. Brown malty nose with impact of coffee. Mixed taste profile of coffee, nuts and cocoa. Mid-sweet brown malty ending. Gentle and nice (√òksnehallen, Copenhagen 13.05.2016).
Pours dark chestnut brown with a brown head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, roast and caramel. Taste is sweet. Medium bodied, smooth and oily, low carbonation. Nice.
tap @CBC16. Clear, dark copper, small beige head. Aroma has cocoa and coffee, some nuts. Flavour is nutty with cocoa and roast. rather light.
On tap at CBC 2016. Brown, thin tan head. Cocoa, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, some vanilla.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Brown with ruby highlights and a light tan head. Aroma is coffee, hazelnut, vanilla, chocolate. Medium bodied, well balanced palate, lightly roasty and nutty finish. Taste is coffee, hazelnut, chocolate, Brazil nuts.
On tap at CBC 2016. Smell of coffee, dark malts and a roasted aroma. Similar taste with vanilla and chocolate. Nice and tasty. Light but lots of favour.
CBC2016. Klare orange braune Farbe, mittelgro√üe br√§unliche Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Kaffee und Schokolade. Geschmack Kaffee Sahne, Vanille.

Draught at CBC.
Pours dark brown.
Aroma of coffee and milk chocolate.
Smooth chocolate, cacao and coffee.
Draft at Hunahpu day ¬í16: brown-black pour, beige head. aroma of roasted malts, coffee, vanilla. tastes are bitter coffee, fudge-chocolate, vanilla. slick thinnish palate.

@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, YELLOWdark brown. Cold coffee, pr rather dry coffee,on nose, chocolate. Med bodied, some sweetness, cocoa, cacao nibs. Pretty ok. Smooth clean tasty.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tap @ CBC -16. Dark copper hued with a light tan head. Really nice coffee aroma with notes of dark chocolate ans vanilla. Taste is light sweet with a chocolaty-coffee flavor. Low bitterness. Long coffee aftertaste.
From tap at CBC 2016. It pours ruby brown with a small off white head. The aroma is cocoa and coffee. Mild caramel malty. Mainly roasted coffee and light cocoa and vanilla. Meh.
Tap cbc. Pours cloudy brown with a head. Aroma of cocoa, coffee, herbal, light earthy,vanilla. Taste is alot of cocoa, herbal.

Tap@ CBC 2016. Deep brown color with a thick off white head. Cacao, coffee beans, vanilla in aroma. Bit ashy. Flavor has cacao, vanilla, chocolate, roasted malt, sweetness. Quite smooth, good drinkability.
Tap out CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Chocolate, cacao and roasted malts.
Keg at cbc16 dark brown black... Dark coffee chocolate roast malts nose.. Dark roast... Heavy coffee.. Thin body

On tap at Brixie¬ís Beer Bar & Grill in Brookfield, IL. choosing a smaller serving, dispensed to a 7 oz. hi-ball glass showing a clear, amber highlighted, brown tone, with a presentable layer of tan head foam, and curtainy cling to the lacing. The nose was roasted, coffee & cocoa/ mocha notes, vanilla, light nuttiness, and a pleasant but non-cloying blend of caramel & toffee sweetness. The taste was similar, light to medium bodied, with somewhat soft carbonation, and earthy bitterness that added a bit of roasted astringency. Nicely amped dimension to an already appreciated Brown Ale.

At Bru (Bro) with Joe, poured a lighter brown color with average head. Notes of cold pressed coffee, English mild or brown ale malt, hazelnut, and earth. So smooth and easy going for a coffee brew. Big fan of this offering from Surly.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 Draft at Bru Craft. Very dark brown clear pour with minimal head. Roasty cold coffee. Cocoa beans. Burnt peanut shells. Vanillin. Cassia. Works well enough as a whole but not terribly exciting. Have had way too many better coffee brews that easily surpass this one.

Draft. Aroma blends earthy coffee, soil, sourdough, sweet vanilla bean, milk chocolate--very much like smelling cold-brew coffee with vanilla creamer. The flavor kicks off with coffee beans, earthy again, leading into soil-covered cocoa nibs before a mildly bitter finish that sails away from the palate. Incredibly clean and mild finish for how much flavor there is up front. Smooth medium-light body; mild prickly CO2. Only builds upon the already-great Coffee Bender.

Tap at the source. Pours clear deep ruby amber, tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roasted malt. Really nice. Flavor is coffee, vanilla, roasted malts. Excellent. A little too thin, otherwise great.
Dark brown pour with a thin off white head. Coffee, vanilla, chocolate and a little dark/burnt caramel aroma. Taste is similar, but sweetish finish

Tasted on draft at Hunahpu Day 16. This is an incredible brown. Aroma is fresh roasted coffee and chocolate. Flavor is big time coffee with vanilla and chocolate. Similar to some stouts with flavor but a little more thin being a brown. Right up there with a couple Cigar City beers as my all time favorite brown. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the brewery. My dessert beer after lunch. No notes but solid chocolate flavors.

Pour from growler into surly pint glass pours dark brown with a fast dissapating head aromas of vanilla coffee and chocolate tastes alot like the aroma coffee hints of vanilla and a tootsie roll chocolate flavor if you enjoy coffee you will love this one from surly!üëç
Amazing aroma of chocolate and cocoa, pours a light brown color with a lasting tan head. Taste is a bit disappointing dry feel with a bitter chocolate taste. An interesting smoked vanilla finish.

Keg @ Surly. Deep reddish pour with a small off-white head. Coffee creamer, lactose. Nuts. Toasted brown bread and chocolate. Similar flavor. Creamy but quite dry. Vanilla. Roasted malts. Pepper. Medium body, full carb.

Tap; pours dark brown with a tan head; aroma of chocolate, nuts, vanilla, and coffee; light sweet taste of chocolate, vanilla, and coffee with hints of nuts; finish is mostly dry with some hints of chocolate; very good
(Un √©chantillon au Stone 19th Anniversary): Un lait frapp√©e chocolat et pate √† biscuit avec un aspect fruit√©. Le corps n¬íest pas d√©cadent.

this is the best in class for brown ales. strong notes of chocolate, milk, roasted malts, and coffee. has a strong black coffee finish. pours dark brown with a thin tan head. had a draft pour at black rock as part of a tap take over. ridiculously good.

Draft. Black. Frothy off white head. Beautiful smooth coffee. Dark chocolate. Vanilla stays in support. Medium body. Not really roasty. Not bitter. Good balance. How much better can a coffee beer get?
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2015 Brown colour. A bit of head. Light mouthfeel. Smooth but not so drinkable. At the brewery.

On tap: The aroma consists of moderate chocolate, caramel, light vanilla, coffee, and a touch of nuts. It¬ís a dark brown with some orange transparency and a one finger beige head that fades to a thin film. There are solid rings left on the sides of the glass with each sip. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate and lighter caramel. The finish has light roast, vanilla, coffee, and a hint of nuts. It¬ís light-medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.
Cuckoo for cacao? Good beer for coffee heads, but a bit sweet to my tastes. Nice in a flight size serving, but I didn¬ít crave the pint.

Dark brown. Sweet cocoa aroma. Taste- mocha favor, roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. A quality porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep opaque mahogany, light tan head. Roast espresso, light cocoa. Signifantly bitter, drier body. Long coffee finish with a lingering hint of vanilla, medium body, fairly effervescent. Pretty good, coffee overpowers the vanilla and cacao unfortunately.

Pours a deep brown with a tan lacing. The aroma is cocoa, coffee, and toasty malt with a flavor of cocoa, dark malt, vanilla and a chocolate finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Dark brown with medium tan head. Aroma of brewed coffee and dark chocolate. Medium body, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, light sweetness.
Draft at surly. Brown with bubbly brown head. Coffee and cocoa aroma and taste. Rich and candy like. Tasty
[5/3/15] Draught during Mikkeller Beer Run in Copenhagen. Nice creamy beige head. Great chocolate aroma. Sweetish flavor with chocolate, nuts, some roast. Very good.
On draft during Madison Craft Beer Week. Huge coffee aroma. Like being in a Starbucks. Awesome coffee taste. Love the vanilla and cacao nibs. Turned it into an awesome mocha style beer.

Outside Kihoskh, CPH, whilst running the Mikkeller 5K 03/04/15.
Rich brown with a big old tan head.
Nose is biscuit, chocolate malt, light coffee, earthy, trace of vanilla.
Taste comprises chocolate biscuit, caramel, light coffee grinds, fruit cake crumbs.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with light hop notes.
Solid brown, plenty of flavour.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft at Surly. Pours a deep caramel/brown with a finger of light tan head that coats the glass. Aroma is rich and slightly smoky with dark chocolate, caramel, woody nut shells, and espresso. Taste is balanced. Starts put with dark chocolate and vanilla, then moves to rich chocolate and coffee, then ends creamy with more espresso and vanilla on the ending. Bit of fruity yeast influence as well. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Fairly clean in the mouth with a soft carbonation. Overall very nice. Dark and rich chocolate mixed with vanilla, coffee, and a touch of fruity yeast.

10oz sample on tap at brewery. Minneapolis.

Pours dark brown with slight ruby tint. 

Aroma is chocolate, coffee,vanilla. Really smells nice. 

Taste is slightly bitter, like dark chocolate, but balanced with sweetness. 

Body is medium. Soft carbonation. Medium finish. 

Overall, this beer has a lot to like about it. Aroma is great. I know body is supposed to be lighter, but it would be so much better if it were
A bit more rich.

On tap at the brewery. Pour is clear caramel with a big white head and good lacing. Huge coffee aroma - some brown sugar, caramel, light vanilla, bread, and a hint of spice. Taste is sweet vanilla, roasted espresso, spice, rye bread, grass, and cookie malt. Light body with medium carbonation. Tasty stuff.

Tap at Apex for Gigantic and Friends

A: Dark brown bordering on black, thin creme colored head,, light lacing. 

N: Coffee, cocoa, char, vanilla, lots of roast, black peppercorn, some earth, and milk chocolate. 

T: Bittersweet like dark chocolate

M: Lighter body, fuzzy carbonation, no alcohol presence. 

O: Another winner from Surly. This is balanced and deft; I can¬ít compare it to anything immediate except maybe a porter.

Draft during EBF weekend. Poured a medium to darker brown with an average sized beige head. Aroma dusty grains, chocolate grains, earthy bread and cereal. Flavor is the same as the aroma but with slightly more chocolate. Medium body with light carbonation.
Draft at Parlor City. Pours dark brown with very little head. Nose is coffee. Taste is coffee with dark chocolate. Better than coffee Bender.
Great coffee and chocolate smell. Dark brown appearance with tan head. Coffee and lovely chocolate taste that¬ís mildly bitter. My favorite version of Bender!

On tap at the brewery. Pours a deep brown with a creamy brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma combines bitter chocolate and coffee with a backing of dark grains and light roast. Flavor has more coffee with a growing chocolate and some dark grains backing.

On tap at Surly Brewing. Black with a decent beige head. Aroma is of cocoa, vanilla, coffee, chocolate bread, and roasted malts. Taste is of roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, toast, light earth, burnt caramel.

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a dark ruby brown color with a longlasting off-white head. Has a slightly roasted malty strong cacao aroma. Fruity malty cacao and vanilla flavor with bitter hints. Has a fruity malty cacao finish.

Fad: Brun klar √∏l med et fint skumhoved. Masser af kakao i duften, men samtidig er den ogs√• bakket op af et godt skud citrushumle som g√∏r at √∏llen ikke kammer over. Meget fin √∏l og meget drikbar.

Dark brown in color, light tan head... Aroma of coffee, cocoa, vanilla, roasted malts... Flavor is sweet roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, cocoa, light chocolate finish... Really nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Taste is a bit thin for the darkness. Great pour. Glad I sampled and I will get again.

Tap at binkies. Dark brown pour with nice head. Awesome coffee and vanilla nose. Clean, crisp, coffee finish. I have had this the last few years and dare to say as a coffee lover this is the best yet. A nice surprise, well done Surly! Cheers!

On draft. Ruby brown in colour with moderate carbonation. Aromas are of chocolate milk powder, pale malt, and a touch of roast. Fairly milk chocolate focused in the mouth, along with elements of vanilla, minerals and red grape. Slick bodied, but the finish is refreshing and dry. I still prefer coffee Bender, but this isn¬ít too far off in terms of quality.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Clear dark reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, cocoa and vanilla. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and short finish. 211114

From tap. Pours hazy brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty, toffee and coffee roasted. Bitter, coffee and roasted malty. Dry and roasted dark malty finish. Bitter and dry finish.

@ Mikkeller Stockholm 14-11-8: stor doft och smak av torr choklad samt sm√• toner av kaffe och vanilj. Lite f√∂r tunn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!
Draft; Dark brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, vanilla, cocoa, & coffee; Flavor of roasted malt, vanilla bean, milk chocolate, some caramel, and coffee; Very good!

Dark brown with small, white head. Significant vanilla bean, milk chocolate, roasted malts, minerals and light earthy hop. Flavor is sweet with a light dry bitterness. Body is lighter with larger bubbles. Quite tasty.

On tap at Mikkeller Stockholm. 

Dark brown with a small head. Aroma and taste dominated by chocolate and cacao. Also some light vanilla, caramel and coffee. The mouthfeel was soft.

Fat p√• mikkeller and friends - doften kakao sl√•r emot en som en √∂rfil i juni. M√∂rkt brun i f√§rgen. Klar som typ en Newcastle. Smakar inte s√• mycket kakao, man kan k√§nna lite vanilj i bakgrunden.
Som en flytande chocklad/kakao- kaka. Aromen men lite mer syrlighet. Lite l√§tt i kroppen.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate and vanilla, lightly roasty. Taste is initial chocolate sweet followed by lightly roasty bitter before a long dark chocolate and leather finish. Fairly light body, smooth with average carbonation.

On tap. Pours a brownish-red color with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel and cacao/chocolate. Served way too cold which made it pretty anonymous, but after a bit of warming up in my hands more destinct flavours of malt, nuts, caramel, vanilla and lots of chocolate, cacao appeared. Body and carbonation is medium. Not bad.

Tap. Beautiful, deep brown body with a medium sized, creamy, beige head that leaves a fair lacing. Aroma of caramel, slightly roasted malt, cocoa, nuts, coffee, vanilla and breaddy notes. Sweet flavor that end up more dry and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily text. and soft carbonation. A great Brown

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2014 Tap @ Surly: Brown, semi-translucent body with a slight murkiness to it; moderately foamy, beige cap. Aroma on-point with milky chocolates, sweet cream, city roast coffee beans, a touch of vanilla that grows with time, & a mild touch of caramel malt. Perfectly transcribes to the palate. Nice base of semisweet chocolates with a back & forth balance between the faintly roasted coffee beans & the pleasantly sweet, creamy vanilla notes. Smallest touch of roast, caramel malts, & a bit of toffee with mostly chocolate & a hint of coffee left lingering. Thin-ish body. I¬ím already a big fan of Bender & Coffee Bender, so I had no doubt I¬íd really enjoy this stuff. Delicious.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy dark brown colored with a small off-white head.
Sweet and light roasted aroma of caramel and coffee with notes of cocoa powder.
Light roasted flavor of caramel with notes of chocolate and cold coffee.
Light roasted finish.
Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear dark brown - offwhite head. Cocoa. Vanilla. Acid. Roasted. Nutty. Some bitterness. Light coffee. Thin finish. Ok.
On tap at Darkness day. Pours dark brown with big head. Smells of spice with vanilla and chocolate. Taste of roasted coffee with slight chocolate. Good beer.

On tap 2014 GTMW, pours brown with a light tan head, the aroma is what you would expect I guess, very heavy chocolate with a good malt backing and fudge as well, the flavor has a chocolate front end with a smooth finish, mouthfeel is smooth and feels really nice, enjoyable stuff.

On tap at Town Hall Brewery. Pours a dark brown with a thick light tan head. Aroma of chocolate, fudge, tootsie rolls, roasted malt. Flavor of chocolate tootsie rolls and milk chocolate fudge, with sweet malt, perhaps a wisp of mocha in the finish. Very chocolate heavy, tasty.
7/4/8/4/14 (3.7/5)
Draft at Churchkey. Thanks, Corey, for bringing this to DC! Clear brown color. Huge aroma of French press coffee. Taste is like beautifully carbonated coffee, soft roast. Very nice.

Tap at Toronado, Seattle. Pours a dark reddy brown with a tan head. Aroma is coffee, hint of lemon. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Choc, coffee, vanilla ice cream, a little lemon. OK, though a bit thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at ToronadoN. Pours like chocolate coal with fine bubbled khaki head. Cheap diner coffee, loads of chocolate. Chocolate donuts, in fact. No sprinkles. Sweet with lasting chocolate-coffee finish. Makes my stomach hurt.

Draft pour at the Toronado Seattle opening. Pours a near black with a super roast coffee bean aroma. Just when I think I have had the "coffee - ist" beer, I try this one and it shuts the other ones up. Mostly roasted coffee bean flavors with a touch of mocha chocolate. Long roasted palate. Overall, I¬ím quite impressed. Good beer here.

On tap at the source. Never would have said a brown for style - has everything one would want in a "coffee" stout. Huge roast nose, with chocolate & caramel, and some light nuttiness. Taste is more bitter espresso, with a nice sweeter chocolate/caramel blend. Rich with a lot of body. Finishes strong and roasty bitter, but with balance back. This was excellent!

Sample at Great Taste of the Midwest on 08/09/2014: Clear dark brown color with a medium beige head that recedes steadily to a film. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Light-bodied with flavors of sweet cocoa, coffee and roast malt. The finish is sweet with a vanilla mocha aftertaste. Good beer all around.

On tap at Surly. Pours a clear dark brown with a half inch of head that leaves spotty lacing. Aroma is ... Chocolate milk. Exactly. Flavor is mild version of same with moderate carbonation and medium body. A delicious beer, and I would have again in a heartbeat.

4oz pour at Churchkey DC. Pours a hazy deep brown with a ring of lacing, white head. Nose has cocoa pods, nutty, a little walnut meat, malty, toast, some cream soda. Flavors of chocolate powder, malt, brown sugar, a little coffee, some vanillin. Mostly dry finish.
Good cacao and some vanilla here. Pours clear mahogany with good head and lacing. Soft carbonation. Finishes a little bitter. Tap takeover at Churchkey.
On draft at Churchkey in DC. Pours a clear cola with an ecru head. Coffee nose. Flavors of coffee , cocoa and a hint of licorice. Medium bodied. Bitter finish.

4oz draft at ChurchKey during the SAVOR Surly event. Poured a dark brown color with a nice light tan head. Aroma was like cold-pressed coffee, lots of roast - dark chocolate notes. Flavor was like a cold hot-chocolate had been lightly poured into a nice cold coffee. Light vanilla bean. Very pleasant and enjoyable.

Tap. Fluffy two fingers of an eggshell head, deep dark brown. Lots of coffee, burnt toast, dark chocolate, and vanilla in the aroma. Damn tasty, chocolate, roast, smooth vanilla easing into a milkshake finish. Lighter smooth slick body .

4 ounces on draft at ChurchKey during the SAVOR Surly event. Pours a dark brownish color with light tan head. Aromas of coffee and grounds, roast. Tasting notes of coffee and grounds, roast, light vanilla and chocolate, toast. Medium body with a dry finish.

Pours a reddish, dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is a lot of chocolate with coffee notes. Flavor is roasted malt with a some great coffee notes along with vanilla and caramel and a big dark chocolate finish. Medium body with soft carbonation. Great brew.

Very good drinking beer. True clean balanced favors. Excellent body. Ditto finish, though a tad on the rich side. Great appearance, good head retention. Had several of these. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Dark black pour, a little thin carbonation and an aroma of rich high end dark chocolate and a little vanilla. It has the similar rich malty profile of bender, but heavy on the chocolate flavor with some hints of vanilla sweetness on the aftertaste. Nice take on the original, and way better in my opinion.

On tap @ Surly Darkness day 2013. Black with a medium khaki head. Aroma and flavor of cocoa, vanilla extract, coffee roast, and toffee. Finish is sweet and roasted, like a coffee with cream and sugar.

Bi√®re brune aux reflets rouge√¢tres, v√™tue d¬íun col de mousse cr√®me tenace. Le nez est l√©ger comme l¬íair avec une touche volatile de noix. En bouche, la douceur √©tonne d¬íentr√©e de jeu. Puis, une douce amertume s¬íimpose, appuy√©e par de puissantes saveurs de caf√©, de douces sensations vanill√©es et de br√®ves impressions caram√©lis√©es. En arri√®re-go√ªt, il ne reste que cette vague amertume qui ne semble jamais vouloir rejoindre le rivage. C¬íest bon, dans √† peu pr√®s tous les sens du terme.

Pour on tap, reddish dark brown pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of big dark bakers chocolate, roast, big coffee note into a bit of vanilla bean, nice nutty note as well. Taste is a mix of big dark chocolate, coffee, cocoa powder into a bit of vanilla, roast, some acidic dark malt, hints of nuts, finishing slightly sweet, slightly bitter. Good stuff.

This is incredible. Aroma of very dark chocolate, sweet malts, and coffee. Taste is out of this world, great coffee and chocolate taste witha a very balanced finish. I love bender and this just steps it up multiple notches....this might be my new favorite beer. Wish I had more! On tap at pizza luce by the way, go there !

Draft at Butcher and the Boar. Pours a clear, brown color with a tan head and some lacing. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, maybe some vanilla. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, dark chocolate, some coffee, some malty nuttiness, with a sweet, chocolate finish. Very tasty.
Heavy cacao aroma. Silky smooth. Like drinking the best cup of coffee you¬íve had, but in beer form. Just enough cacao and vanilla sweetness to balance the bitterness really well.
Love bender and all variations that I¬íve tried. Aromas of great coffee and milk chocolate. Flavors are cold coffee and darker chocolate. Delicious!
Major coffee and cocoa aroma. Dark brown body. Tastes like a Coffee Crisp bar. Nice. On tap at surly tap room.

A clear dark brown ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, superb cacao nibs, milk chocolate, light coffee, very nice. In mouth, a nice light cacao with caramel malt, light vanilla, very smooth and silky. On tap at End of Everything beer fest Dec 22 2013.

The easiest thing about submitting this portion of my radio is that I can¬ít say enough about the delicious ness of this beer. I would be very sad if this beer disappeared or was never bottled or canned. Hopefully it everyone who reads this will understand how much I actually enjoy drinking this beer. 1 word = DELICIOUS!

A really solid stout, hampered only by it¬ís palate. I think the texture was a bit too watery, albeit smooth. May have been due to it being the end of a keg. Pour was dark brown, very white thick head. TAste was not bitter or smoky as expected, hints of vanilla, chocolate, and coffee. 

On tap at Chino Latino.
Draft: pours dark brown with a thin white head, coffee aroma and taste with a bit of the vanilla. More or less like coffee bender to me.
Smoke and chocolate make an excellent combination. Coffee and cocoa on the tongue and a wonderfully smooth finish. Delicious.
Truly delicous beer, huge flaovr for its abv. Coffee and cocoa are the main players.
On tap at Darkness Day. Poured black brown with beige head. Choc coffee bean aromas. Med carb and bod. Slight bitter taste. The best out of the benders Ive had.

Light sweet milk chocolaty aroma. Very dark and just slightly red on the edges. Very dark chocolaty flavor. Hint of coffee and hazelnut. Has a slightly light milky texture, and a light tobacco finish. Extremely drinkable. This beer is amazing.
Great aroma. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla hints. This is a dark, remarkably smooth beer.

On tap at Republic Uptown, pours a dark brown with ruby highlights and a medium tan head. Taste of bitter earthy coffee and bitter hops balanced nicely with chocolate and vanilla sweetness, caramel and toffee malts. Always a pleasure to find this one on tap, delicious and easy drinking!
Draft at Surley. Very interesting. Vanilla and chocolate with a definite bitter coffee finish. Very good.
Tap. Black. Smells of coffee. Slight vanilla, but mostly coffee stout flavor. Good, not great.
Solid chocolate and coffee aroma. Similar palate with added roasted malt. Starts bitter but finishes smooth. Tasty stuff
@RBSG-Minni¬ñon tap-lt brown-black. A-coffee/roasty, earth. T-coffee/roasty, earth hop bite.

Tap at Pizza Luc√©. Dark brown with a thin ring at the top. Significant vanilla bean, milk chocolate, roasted malts, minerals and light earthy hop. Flavor is sweet with a light dry bitterness. Body is lighter with larger bubbles. Quite tasty.

Draught at the Surly Taproom. Strong coffee nose, but scorched a bit too much. Dark brown, brilliant ruby highlights. Coffee, some vanilla, but again mostly burnt coffee. Thin-medium body. Okay. Not a great coffee brew.
All Pints North 2013. Lots of chocolate and vanilla in aroma and the flavor. Brown color. Bitter coffee finish.

Draft pour at GTMW 2013. Pours a nice brown color with a biege head. Cacao nibs and vanilla beans are immediately evident, with toasted malts, nuts, and really light coffee. So much chocolate in this. Light-bodied, with a dry, toasty, sweet mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Nice chocolaty brown ale.

On tap at surly. Pours brown and hazy with a soapy khaki head that leaves a soapy film. Aroma has big chocolate roasted malt faint bitterness. Taste starts bitter and turns with awesome chocolate roasted malt and nuttiness. Palate is medium chalky and dry.
Pour ar Republic at the RBSG brunch. Light brown pour. Coffee and chocolate nose. Roasted malty goodness happening here with chocolate bitterness on the finish.

This is my favorite beer--ever. What is so stunning, too, besides the complex flavor-fulness, is it¬ís mouth-feel or palate. There is a perfect balance of roasted malt and chocolate and coffee and hops. This is a brew I dream about.
On tap in the tap room. Awesome variant on Bender here with the cacao nibs. They are really prominent in something other than a stout, which I like. Even better than coffee.
On tap at Surly. Pours a black color with tan head. Chocolate, malty, coffee, vanilla flavors. Smells and tastes like a mocha. Really nice.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Tap at Surly¬ís new tap room. Very dark pour with a tight off white head. Bold aroma of coffee, vanilla, and chocolate. Taste is similar. Moderate palate. Awesome!
On tap at the brewery. Clear transparent brown pour with a big fluffy tan head. Aroma is chocolate and coffee. Some roasted malt. Good beer. Excellent brown ale.
P amber off white nose vanilla cinnamon choc, haElnut fl vanilla coffee choc cinnamonhazelnuts good mellow brown

tap at Blue Nile, served in a goblet, a nice deep brown with reddish tinge coming through the edges, taste is identical to chocolate chip pancakes. sweet chocolate, light vanilla and a bready  taste.. not bad but i didnt find myself wanting a whole lot of it.

Tap @ Stub and Herbs Darkness Eve. Pours a bit cloudy, dark brown appearance with a brown head. Chocolate milky, rich cocoa, light coffee, vanilla aroma. A little thin, huge chocolate powder, vanilla, light wood, Hershey¬ís flavor.

The aroma is striking--I shared it with others who were with me, and even those who didn¬ít put their nose too close could get the straight-up chocolate. Very much a cacao chocolate power aroma. The flavor is quite chocolatey as well but it is more balanced. This is a brown ale (as described here, at least). I guess that makes sense, particularly in the palate, which has substance but isn¬ít as rich or warm as a stout or even a porter. Drinkable but in my view it didn¬ít have the depth of chocolate flavor that I would prefer if I¬ím drinking a chocolate-themed beer--better off with a good stout with roasted qualities. (on tap at the Groveland Tap, St Paul)

Aromatics are straight chocolate and mild alcohol. Appearance is deep dark brown/black with brown head that is laid on thick! Taste hits with thick chocolate and malt (almost like drinking a melted chocolate bar in your beer). Palate is nice and thick one the most rounded palates I have had. Overall I love this beer! This should be aged in Bourbon Barrels, it would be fantastic!

At Surlyfest 5.
Terriffic dark brown pour with a creamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate and a touch of coffee. Flavor was almost like hot chocolate with some vanilla and coffee mixed in. A great take on the other benders, my favorite of the three. Very smooth and drinkable with the perfect amount of chocolate
Sample at ABR.  Aroma is real nice.  Chocolate and coffee.  Cacao comes through nicely but its still Bender.

Surly Cacao Bender:  Approximately 1 oz. pour on tap at the Autumn Brew Review in Minneapolis on 9-15-12. Smoky aroma features chocolate and pepper scents. Pours a hazy brown. Too much coffee in the flavor (I don¬ít care for coffee). Despite the intriguing smell, this is not my kind of beer.  8/4/5/3/12

On tap at GTMW - Pours brown with a tan head. NOse is chocolate covered hazelnut, tons of chocolatey malt, and a bit of iced coffee. Taste is chocolate milk, nutty malt, with hazelnut present. Mocha waves of goodness. Thick with smooth carbonation.

Draft at GTMW 12. Pours a deep brown with a tan head. The nose is full of sweet cocoa powder, faint coffee and roast. The chocolate is pretty dominant but has a certain sweetness about it. Malt profile to back it up, hops are faded out. On tasting, there is an odd sweetness. Vanilla and cocoa dominate and the body almost seems a bit thinner overall. It starts to get a touch cloying later in the glass, unfortunately. Definitely interesting but not my cup of tea.

Enjoyed at GTMW 2012. The beer poured a brown black with little head. The smell was distinctly cocoa and the taste was mildly chocolate and smooth with dry, bitter hops. The finish was also very bitter and dry - perhaps a bit too dry for my overall tastes but a good beer.

Draft pour on tap at GTMW 2012 (Madison, WI). Pours a rich brownish pour, deeper hues in the middle with touches of glow and carmelized edges. A decent haze, richer light brown head sits atop, big and laces well. Aromas are rich cocoa, brown malts. Mor cacao, a touch toasty, mellow biscuits and bready malts. A touch nutty, earthy as the brown malts take over. Initial is rich cocoa bean, wow the flavor is fierce. Good rich cocoa, toffee, and earthy and mellow sweet brown malts. Toffee, earth, tobacco. Richer cocoa into the backend and finish. Middle is more Bender based, brown and earth, mellow sweetness with just a touch of girth. Backend offers more roasty cacao, coffee, and richer big cocoa flavors. Finish is a bit roasty and dry, linger cocoa elements. Really nice.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 GTMW.  Dark brown pour.  Aroma is fresh roast coffee and soft cocoa powder.  Almost like a the front half of your inhalation is coffee and the second half is hot cocoa.  Flavor is a semi-bitter coffee roast, unsweetened cocoa powder, and the faintest of vanilla.  Seems to be more bitter overall than the base beer with the addition of the cacao nibs.  An enjoyable, but a notch below the original in my opinion.  Re-rate.  Tap MBC.  Nice gritty dark chocolate with roast.  Love it.  +1

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2012 Had this at the All Pints North festival in Duluth, MN.Had a nice chocolate peanut butter browning scent, taste is a creamy smooth chocolate with a light roast. Best beer of the fest by far.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2015 July 21, 2012 on tap at All Pints North.  Dark brown pour with head.  Aroma was like a dark chocolate brownie and the taste matched.  Medium bodied.  Wow was this amazing, had my vote for best beer of the fest...granted I wasn?t able to get any Czar Jack, but still.

Had this quite a few times since initial rating and dropped aroma to an 8 for a 4.1 overall.
